newsitem.title: USA: MCN, Equitable to develop acreage.
newsitem.headline: MCN, Equitable to develop acreage.

text.p: MCN Investment Corp, a unit of MCN Corp, and Equitable Resources Energy Co, a unit of Equitable Resources Inc, said on Thursday that they reached agreements on two oil and gas development projects, one in Virginia and the other in Utah.

The two companies entered into a joint venture involving the drilling of up to 360 coalbed methane wells in southwest Virginia over a seven-year period, covering 21,600 acres in Equitable Resources' Nora Field.
The first of 20 wells of the Nora Field joint project have been drilled and are in various stages of completion.

Preliminary results for these initial wells indicate production rates will be consistent with the average rate from coalbed methane wells currently producing in the field. A total of 70 wells are planned by the end of 1997.
The Utah project involves a joint development agreement covering about 24,000 gross acres in Duchesne and Uintah counties, adjacent to Equitable's ongoing Monument Butte Secondary Recovery Project.
